**CHAPTER 6: DESIGN A KEY-VALUE STORE**: A key-value store, also referred to as a key-value database, is a non-relational database. // get ‚Äúvalue‚Äù associated with ‚Äúkey‚Äù insert ‚Äúvalue‚Äù associated with ‚Äúkey‚Äù - get(key) [Key topics: key, value, store]
**Understand the problem and establish design scope**: There is no perfect design. ‚Ä¢ Low latency. Tunable consistency. [Key topics: design, system, tradeoff]

**Distributed key-value store**: A distributed key-value store is also called a distributed hash table, which distributes key- value pairs across many servers. When designing a distributed system, it is important to understand CAP (Consistency, Availability, Partition Tolerance) theorem. [Key topics: distribute, value, design]
